sime.tcp

Class SenderState

  • java.lang.Object
    • sime.tcp.SenderState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SenderStateCongestionAvoidance, SenderStateFastRecovery, SenderStateSlowStart

    public abstract class SenderState
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the TCP sender state interface.
    Example sender states are: "slow start", "congestion avoidance", "fast recovery", etc. The derived classes provide the behavior specific to the given state.

    This class implements the State design pattern.

    Author:
    Ivan Marsic
    See Also:
    SenderStateSlowStart, SenderStateCongestionAvoidance, SenderStateFastRecovery

    • Method Detail

      • calcCongWinAfterNewAck

        protected abstract int calcCongWinAfterNewAck(int ackSequenceNumber_,
                         int lastByteAcked_)
        Helper method to calculate the new value of the congestion window after a "new ACK" is received that acknowledges data never acknowledged before.
        This method also resets the RTO timer for any outstanding segments.
        This abstract method is implemented by different actual sender states.

        Clarification: Recent variants of TCP, such as NewReno, distinguish "partial" and "full" new acknowledgments. Any data that was outstanding unacknowledged at the time when a segment loss is detected is considered "old data". An ACK that acknowledges these data partially is called a "partial ACK". An ACK that acknowledges these data completely is called a "full ACK".

        Parameters:
        ackSequenceNumber_ - acknowledged data sequence number
        lastByteAcked_ - last byte previously acknowledged
        Returns:
        the new value of the congestion window

      • handleDupACK

        public SenderState handleDupACK(Segment dupAck_)
        Counts a duplicate ACK and checks if the count equals 3. If exactly three dupACKs are received, it performs the fast retransmit and updates the congestion parameters.

        Tahoe ignores additional dupACKs over and above the first three. Reno doesn't—it counts them within its fast recovery procedure. See SenderStateFastRecovery.handleDupACK(Segment).

      • handleNewACK

        public SenderState handleNewACK(Segment ack_)
        Processes a single new (i.e., not duplicate) acknowledgment. This method calls calcCongWinAfterNewAck(int, int) to perform the state-dependent calculation of the new congestion window size, as well as to reset the RTO timer.
        Parameters:
        ack_ - The current acknowledgment segment, to be processed.
        Returns:
        Returns the next state to which the TCP sender transitions.

      • handleRTOtimeout

        public SenderState handleRTOtimeout(Segment oldestUnackedSeg_)
        Processes the TCP sender reaction to a retransmission timer (RTO) timeout.
        Method called on the expired retransmission timeout (RTO) timer. After this kind of an event, the next state in any type of a TCP sender is always reset to slow-start.
        Parameters:
        oldestUnackedSeg_ - Currently the oldest unacknowledged segment (presumably lost), to be retransmitted.
        Returns:
        Returns the next state to which the TCP sender transitions.

      • lookupNextStateAfterNewAck

        protected abstract SenderState lookupNextStateAfterNewAck()
        Helper method to look-up the next state that the sender will transition to after it received a "new ACK".
        Returns:
        the next state to transition to.
